ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We talked a lot about china's problems such as pollution, the one-child policy, as well as democracy. There's also a lot of chance to practice for oral presentations.
My knowledge of current affairs and how to express my opinions in Chinese.

I learned how to talk coherently in Chinese about foreign relations and political science issues, like democracy and human rights. I also learned to talk about academic subjects in sociology such as globalization and societal change.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: there's a lot of semi open topic presentations, so you actually learn a lot because everyone wants to talk about different niche things.

A strength is our teacher incorporated many debates and conversations in our classes to help us engage with the content.

A weakness is that we covered many long texts and sometimes we did not have the time to go into enough depth.

This course was strong in that it improved our reading ability (the readings were long and numerous). It could be improved by forcing students to more actively respond to questions in class. More questions and more expectations of active participation would help motivate better student preparation for the class and encourage more practice at verbal articulation

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, you learn a lot from your classmates because of the small class discussion format. not just chinese, but also their views and rathionales on a lot of social issues.
Yes I would, our teacher prepares very well for every lesson and clearly maps out our syllabus.
Yes! I love the readings. Shen Laoshi is also an insightful thinker and a great mentor in guiding us through these topics in Chinese. It's a fantastic class.
